page.title: 01Billericay
page.content: 540{ Billericay}is a pleasant commuter town situated about 30 km (50 miles) from London and is served by a railway from Southend to London. The area has been inhabited since the Iron Age.{Roman }remains have been discovered, people from Bilericay joined the{Peasant's Revolt,}and pilgrims travelled to the New World on board the{Mayflower. { }Billericay is an expanding town but the area studied is mainly arable farming and a small area of deciduous wood land. There are also scattered small holdings. The {High Street}contains the main shopping area together with the library, Arts Centre, ambulance fire and police stations. Gas and Electricity showrooms are there, and the Water Authority. Housing is mainly owner occupied.
